newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan forgoes buying Australian wheat due to price.
newsitem.headline: Japan forgoes buying Australian wheat due to price.

text.p: Japan's Food Agency said on Friday it did not buy any Australian wheat at yesterday's import tender due to higher-than-expected prices.
The agency had been planning to buy 20,000 tonnes of Standard White wheat and 20,000 of Prime Hard wheat from Australia, an agency official said.
"But their prices were higher than we had expected," he said. "We will try to buy some (Australian wheat) next week."
He did not disclose the Australian wheat offer prices.
On Thursday, the Food Agency bought 40,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat, 40,000 tones of Canadian wheat and 20,000 tonnes of Australian barley.
